title: Anand Marriage Act, 1909
description: Official consolidated text of Anand Marriage Act, 1909 (VII of 1909) published by The Pakistan Code (Family Laws).

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title and extent
provisions.content:
_(1) This Act may be called the Anand Marriage Act, 1909 ; and
2
[(2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan.]

provisions.title: Section 2. Validity of Anand marriage. All marriages which may be or may have been duly
provisions.content:
solemnized according to the Sikh marriage ceremony called Anand shall be, and shall be deemed to
have been with effect from the date of the solemnization of each respectively, good and valid in law.

provisions.title: Section 3. Exemption of certain marriage from Act. Nothing in this Act shall apply toâ€“
provisions.content:
(a)        any marriage between persons not professing the Sikh religion, or
(b)         any marriage which has been judicially declared to be null and void.

provisions.title: Section 4. Saving of marriages solemnized according to other ceremonies. Nothing in this Act shall
provisions.content:
affect the validity of any marriage duly solemnized according to any other marriage ceremony
customary among the Sikhs.

provisions.title: Section 5. Non
provisions.content:
validation of marriages within prohibited degrees. Nothing in this Act shall be
deemed to validate any marriage between persons who are related to each other in any degree of
consanguinity or affinity which would, according to the customary law of the Sikhs, render a marriage
between them illegal.
